TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit HostProtectionAttribute extends System.Security.Permissions.CodeAccessSecurityAttribute
Public NotInheritable Class HostProtectionAttribute Inherits CodeAccessSecurityAttribute

Attribute.AttributeName: System.AttributeUsage(System.AttributeTargets.Assembly | System.AttributeTargets.Class | System.AttributeTargets.Struct | System.AttributeTargets.Constructor | System.AttributeTargets.Method | System.AttributeTargets.Delegate, AllowMultiple=true, Inherited=false)

System.AttributeUsage(System.AttributeTargets.Assembly | System.AttributeTargets.Class | System.AttributeTargets.Constructor | System.AttributeTargets.Delegate | System.AttributeTargets.Method | System.AttributeTargets.Struct, AllowMultiple=true, Inherited=false)

summary.span: 允許使用宣告式安全性動作以決定主機保護需求。

span.span: Allows the use of declarative security actions to determine host protection requirements.
This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個屬性會影響裝載 common language runtime 以及實作主機保護，例如 SQL Server 未受管理的應用程式。This attribute affects only unmanaged applications that host the common language runtime and implement host protection, such as SQL Server. 如果在用戶端應用程式中或未受主機保護的伺服器上執行程式碼，則屬性會「消失」；它會偵測不到，因此不會進行套用。If the code is run in a client application or on a server that is not host-protected, the attribute "evaporates"; it is not detected and therefore not applied. 套用時，安全性動作會根據類別或方法所公開的主機資源來建立連結要求。When applied, the security action results in the creation of a link demand based on the host resources the class or method exposes. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此屬性的目的是強制執行主機特定程式設計模型方針，而不是安全性行為。The purpose of this attribute is to enforce host-specific programming model guidelines, not security behavior. 雖然使用連結要求來檢查是否與程式設計模型需求一致，但是 不是安全性權限。Although a link demand is used to check for conformance to programming model requirements, the is not a security permission. 如果主機沒有程式設計模型需求，則不會發生連結要求。If the host does not have programming model requirements, the link demands do not occur. 此屬性可識別下列各項：This attribute identifies the following: - 方法或類別，不適合主機程式設計模型但為良性。Methods or classes that do not fit the host programming model, but are otherwise benign. - 方法或類別，不適合主機程式設計模型，而且可能導致伺服器所管理的使用者程式碼不穩定。Methods or classes that do not fit the host programming model and could lead to destabilizing server-managed user code. - 方法或類別，不適合主機程式設計模型，而且可能導致伺服器處理序本身不穩定。Methods or classes that do not fit the host programming model and could lead to a destabilization of the server process itself. > [!NOTE] > 如果您所建立的類別庫是要由可在主機保護環境中執行的應用程式進行呼叫，則應該將此屬性套用至公開 資源分類的成員。If you are creating a class library that is to be called by applications that may execute in a host protected environment, you should apply this attribute to members that expose resource categories. 具有此屬性的 .NET Framework Class Library 成員只會檢查立即呼叫者。The .NET Framework class library members with this attribute cause only the immediate caller to be checked. 程式庫成員也必須以相同的方式檢查其立即呼叫端。Your library member must also cause a check of its immediate caller in the same manner. > [!NOTE] > 請勿使用[Ngen.exe （原生映像產生器）](~/docs/framework/tools/ngen-exe-native-image-generator.md)若要建立受保護的組件的原生映像。Do not use the [Ngen.exe (Native Image Generator)](~/docs/framework/tools/ngen-exe-native-image-generator.md) to create a native image of assemblies that are protected by the . 在完全信任環境中，會一律載入影像，而不考慮，而在部分信任環境不載入影像。In a full-trust environment, the image is always loaded, without regard to the , and in a partial-trust environment the image is not loaded. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何將具有各種屬性值。The following code example illustrates the use of the attribute with a variety of values. [!code-cpp[System.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute.1.1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute.1.1/CPP/hostprotectionattribute.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute.1.1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute.1.1/CS/hostprotectionattribute.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute.1.1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute.1.1/VB/hostprotectionattribute.vb#1)]

Public Overrides Function CreatePermission () As IPermission

summary.span: 建立和傳回新的主機保護權限。

span.span: Creates and returns a new host protection permission.
An that corresponds to the current attribute.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 永遠不會由應用程式程式碼，應該只能由安全性系統，呼叫這個方法。This method should be called only by the security system, never by application code. 在編譯時期，屬性會將安全性宣告轉換為中繼資料的序列化形式。At compile time, attributes convert security declarations to a serialized form in metadata. 從對應至這個方法會傳回屬性的權限建立中繼資料中的宣告式安全性資料。Declarative security data in metadata is created from the permission corresponding to the attribute that this method returns.

summary.span: 取得或設定值，表示是否公開外部處理序管理。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether external process management is exposed.

value.span: 如果公開外部處理序管理，則為 ，否則為 。

span.span: if external process management is exposed; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 公開外部處理序管理的程式碼可能會建立或終結其他處理序。Code that exposes external process management might create or destroy other processes. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何將屬性搭配屬性。The following code example illustrates the use of the attribute with the property. 這個範例是針對提供之較大範例的一部分類別。This example is part of a larger example provided for the class. summary.span: 取得或設定值，表示是否公開外部執行緒。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether external threading is exposed.

value.span: 如果公開外部執行緒則為 ，否則為 。

span.span: if external threading is exposed; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 公開外部執行緒的程式碼會建立，或管理它自己，以外之執行緒可能是對主機有害。Code that exposes external threading creates or manipulates threads other than its own, which might be harmful to the host. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何將屬性搭配屬性。The following code example illustrates the use of the attribute with the property. 這個範例是針對提供之較大範例的一部分類別。This example is part of a larger example provided for the class. [!code-cpp[System.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute.1.1#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute.1.1/CPP/hostprotectionattribute.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute.1.1#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute.1.1/CS/hostprotectionattribute.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute.1.1#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.HostProtectionAttribute.1.1/VB/hostprotectionattribute.vb#6)]

summary.span: 取得或設定值，表示終止作業時，資源是否可能遺漏記憶體。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether resources might leak memory if the operation is terminated.

value.span: 如果終止時資源可能遺漏記憶體，則為 ，否則為 。

span.span: if resources might leak memory on termination; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果不受安全控制代碼或某些其他方法來確保資源的版本，則程式碼在終止時，可能會造成資源流失。Code might cause a resource leak on termination, if not protected by a safe handle or some other means of ensuring the release of resources.

summary.span: 取得或設定旗標，指定可能會對主機有害的功能分類。

span.span: Gets or sets flags specifying categories of functionality that are potentially harmful to the host.
A bitwise combination of the values.
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 旗標會指定方法或類別所公開會對主機可能有害的資源。The flags specify the resources exposed by the method or class that are potentially harmful to the host. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何將屬性搭配屬性。The following code example illustrates the use of the attribute with the property. 這個範例是針對提供之較大範例的一部分類別。This example is part of a larger example provided for the class. span.span: if self-affecting threading is exposed; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 影響自身的執行緒管理執行緒只會影響使用者程式碼的方式。Self-affecting threading manipulates threads in a way that only affects user code. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何將屬性搭配屬性。The following code example illustrates the use of the attribute with the property. 這個範例是針對提供之較大範例的一部分類別。This example is part of a larger example provided for the class.
